snippet: Runggye Adak was jailed for eight years after calling for the spiritual leader’s return to Tibet in a speech at a major festival.
abstract: Chinese authorities release Runggye Adak, Tibetan man imprisoned for eight years for publicly calling for return of Dalai Lama in 2007.
lead_paragraph: Runggye Adak was jailed for eight years after calling for the spiritual leader’s return to Tibet in a speech at a major festival.

headline.main: Tibetan Who Called for Dalai Lama’s Return Is Said to Be Freed From Chinese Prison
headline.print_headline: Tibetan Man Is Said to Be Freed From Chinese Prison
